intro: Chaptalia estribensis, commonly known as the Andean chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, thriving in cool and temperate climates. It features slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
